intro: Hieracium subglobosum, commonly known as the globe hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are heart-shaped or oval. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium subglobosum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
